content.webTitle: Key moments of the Iraq war inquiry's opening day

fields.headline: Key moments of the Iraq war inquiry's opening day
fields.bodyText: Key fact British officials discussed regime change in Iraq in an internal Foreign Office document written in 2001. It was one of several policy options floated and it was dismissed as having "no basis in law". Best quote Sir William Patey on talk of "regime change" in Iraq in US in early 2001: "We were aware of these drumbeats from Washington and internally we discussed it. Our policy was to stay away from that ... We didn't think Saddam was a good thing, and it would be great if he went but we didn't have an explicit policy for trying to get rid of him." Top jargon The NFZ operation. That refers to no-fly zones, covering northern and southern Iraq, the subject of a detailed discussion in the afternoon. Damage rating No smoking gun yet but the hearing underlined how slow Britain was to respond to evidence that the Bush administration wanted to overthrow Saddam Hussein, even though the British government had been advised at the time that this was illegal.
